question.text: Two plates A and B have thermal conductivities <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>84</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">W</mi><mo> </mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo> </mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>126</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">W</mi><mo> </mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo> </mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> respectively. They have same surface area and same thickness. They are placed in contact along their surfaces. If the temperatures of the outer surfaces of  A and B are kept at <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mn>100</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mn>0</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> respectively, then the temperature of the surface of contact in steady state is_____ <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mmultiscripts><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mprescripts></mprescripts><none></none><mo>∘</mo></mmultiscripts></math>.

solution.text:
Let the temperature of the contact surface be T,

So, HA=HB

KAA'(TA-T)L=KBA'(T-TB)L⇒84(100-T)=126(T-0)⇒2(100-T)=3T⇒T=40 °C
